Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7533161065/job/20505161946)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7533161065/job/20505161554)

```suggestion
/-- A subalgebra is isomorphic to its image under an injective `AlgHom` -/
```
or more verbosely, "homomorphism of algebras"
(I see that this is copied from [Subring.equivMapOfInjective](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Subring/Basic.html#Subring.equivMapOfInjective) etc., but those probably should be fixed too ...)

```suggestion
/-- An intermediate field is isomorphic to its image under an `AlgHom`
(which is automatically injective) -/
```
to avoid confusion with `algebraMap`

It seems to me that the right hand side is more complicated, and indeed we seem to use this with `.symm`, so:
```suggestion
theorem range_comp_val : (f.comp L.val).fieldRange = L.map f := toSubalgebra_injective <| by
  rw [toSubalgebra_map, AlgHom.fieldRange_toSubalgebra, AlgHom.range_comp, range_val]
```

```suggestion
theorem range_comp_val : (f.comp S.val).range = S.map f := by
  rw [AlgHom.range_comp, range_val]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `equivMap[OfInjective]` for subalgebra and intermediate field
